summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganKlairs Gentle Black Deep Cleansing Oil melts away dirt and makeup while replenishing skin moisture without any greasy residue.
details: DetailsBenefitsMelts away dirt and makeupHelps control oil to keep pores clearNatural ingredients help prevent premature signs of agingReplenishes skin moisture without leaving behind a greasy feelingStrengthens the skin moisture barrierRich in antioxidants, vitamins and mineralsHypoallergenicKey IngredientsBlack Bean: Softens the look of lines and wrinkles with anti-aging propertiesBlack Currant Seed: A skin-soothing plant extract that helps repair damaged skinBlack Sesame Oil: A non-greasy oil with antibacterial properties for acne-prone skinCranberry Seed Oil: High in antioxidants to protect against pollutantsShea Butter: Provides deep hydration and comforts skinJojoba Oil: Helps nourish and repair skin with vitamin EFormulated WithoutEthanolSiliconeArtificial dyesItem 2546689How To UseUse it as the first step in your double-cleansing routine. Dispense a quarter-sized amount onto dry palms, and massage onto dry skin. Add water to emulsify and transform the oil into a creamy milk. Rinse well with lukewarm water.Precautions: For external use only. Do not get into eyes.IngredientsCaprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Cetyl Ethylhexanoate, Isononyl Isononanoate, PEG-7 Glyceryl Cocoate , Isopropyl Myristate, Simmondsia Chinensis (Jojoba) Seed Oil, Glycine Soja (Soybean) Oil, Sesamum Indicum (Sesame) Seed Oil, Ribes Nigrum (Black Currant) Seed Oil, Tocopheryl Acetate, PEG-20 Glyceryl Triisostearate , Polysorbate 20, Fragrance, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea Butter), Carapa Guaianensis Seed Oil, Vaccinium Macrocarpon (Cranberry) Seed Oil.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Use it as the first step in your double-cleansing routine. Dispense a quarter-sized amount onto dry palms, and massage onto dry skin. Add water to emulsify and transform the oil into a creamy milk. Rinse well with lukewarm water.Precautions: For external use only. Do not get into eyes.

reviews.headline: Average cleansing oil
reviews.comments: Personally didn't work for me. It's very runny and feels too lightweight that it just kind slips around on your skin without doing much. It doesn't clear out sebaceous filaments or pore gunk like other oil cleansers i have tried. It does a decent job removing foundation and sunscreen but it performs poorly with eye makeup like waterproof eyeliner and mascara. I ALWAYS end up with panda eyes and yes I do emulsify it before washing off. Definitely would not purchase again since it does neither of the things I neither of the things that I need it to do. You can get much better for the price honestly.

reviews.headline: BUY THIS NOW
reviews.comments: Omg if you have dry sensitive skin buy this now it didnt irritate my skin or even make it red which is a mircle and my skin looks so soft blackheads where shes gone the only thing i would recommend using warm water when rinsing it is a little hard to wash off but worth it

reviews.headline: Wonderful cleansing oil for dry skin
reviews.comments: I've been using this for over a year and I love it. Takes off the most resistant makeup and sunscreen without leaving my skin stripped. I do double cleanse and use a creamy gentle cleanser afterwards. My skin type is dry leans dehydrated. Not prone to acne but I do have occasional clogged pores.

reviews.headline: My favorite
reviews.comments: I have dry sensitive skin. This product is my favorite. Hydrates and melts off my full coverage foundation and sunscreen. I'm on my 2nd bottle.

reviews.headline: Ew
reviews.comments:
This has to be the worst cleansing oil i've ever owned. I bought this when my go-to cleansing oil was out of stock & just… no. This oil just slips around & doesnt break down any makeup. When you try to wash it off it doesnt move and leaves thee worst greasy film. By the time I went to dry my face my towels were covered with oil & leftover makeup that this did literally nothing to remove. 
Thank gooodness my go-to came back in stock soon after because yikes..

reviews.headline: Very Hydrating. Love it.
reviews.comments: I've been struggling with slacking skin because of retionol. I swapped this product out from my prior cleanser. it's helped a ton. Love this product. Will repurchase

reviews.headline: Love this!!!
reviews.comments:
It worked so well to take off makeup! You definitely need to use on dry skin, then wash off, its just a little less effective on wet skin. But you will need to double cleanse too.

Overall felt great, not irration, and clean off all my makeup!

reviews.headline: Absolutely Love
reviews.comments: I have sensitive skin eczema and dry skin. This product helps hydrate my skin during cold winters or in the triple didget summers in Texas.

reviews.headline: Feels greasy
reviews.comments: This is one of the worst cleansing oils i have tried, it doesn't emulsify very well and doesnt wash off makeup good either, its hard to remove from your face so i don't recommend it!

reviews.headline: Better research next time
reviews.comments:
I was interested in oil cleansing and didn't know where to start. Skipping the chemistry lesson has made my face angry; I haven't had pimples and breakouts like this since my teens.
First, I have combination leaning-oily skin prone to clogged pores, breakouts, and acne, which means I really needed something lower/noncomedogenic. This contains soybean and sesame oil, which don't always play nice with clogging pores.
Application was very runny, but definitely felt effective at clearing sebaceous filaments. It didn't emulsify very well (tried a few different ways) and after rinsing for several min, I still felt oil. Didn't see a difference in breakouts with a double-cleanse.
It smells nice? A very light, sweet scent.

reviews.headline: Nope
reviews.comments: I don't understand at all why anyone likes this cleansing oil….. I love dear klair's but this product leaves behind the worst sticky white film that's so hard to remove. When I get a oil cleanser I want to be able to have it rinse off clean with absolutely no film or weird texture when I use this stuff. I literally have to find an exfoliating brush to get the remainder of it off. Even my second cleanse doesn't get the film off it's so gross. I love earth, Harbor sunshine dew and biossance pre cleansing oil. Those two are nice and thin and they take my sunscreen, (which is the Isdin sunscreen and is extremely hard to get off) right off with no problem. There's no film left behind and I wouldn't even have to use the second cleanse if I was in a hurry

reviews.headline: I love this
reviews.comments: I wish I could give it more stars!!! I think its do amazing & effective! It cleans so well

reviews.headline: I love this
reviews.comments: I wish I could give it more stars!!! I think its do amazing & effective! It cleans so well

reviews.headline: Effective first cleanse
reviews.comments: I really enjoy using this product as a first cleanse to remove makeup. Good value, works well, would repurchase.

reviews.headline: Acne Inducing
reviews.comments: I've used many oil cleansers but strayed from my go to since it was out of stock. I've used other Klairs products and they are my holy grails so I had really high hopes for this oil cleanser… After the first use I started breaking out like CRAZY! This has never happened with others and I double cleanse every time. I thought it was a fluke and so I stopped using it and went back to my old oil cleanser but again ran out. I had this one left over and after using it woke up the next morning with so many pimples. Never purchasing again and it's a shame because I have a full bottle of it.

reviews.headline: Great product
reviews.comments: Great overall product if your someone who has sensitive skin! Definitely a great double cleanser to help remove water proof makeup.

reviews.headline: Great cleanser for double cleansing
reviews.comments: If you aren't using this as part of a double cleanse routine, it's going to leave an oily residue… that said, it is great for the first step in a double cleanse. It effectively breaks up make-up, sunscreen/products and it feels nice to rub around my face. I like how it gets slightly milky when I wet my face after loosening all the gunk. I follow with a foaming cleanser and it is easy to remove that way. The smell is very natural and faint. The only reason i took a star is because it is very runny so it can get messy if you aren't careful and I have found that the bottle pump does leak a little. But this is a great product at worth the price.

reviews.headline: Works well, emulsifies poorly
reviews.comments: I like the consistency, but I do find it doesn't emulsify well and leaves a residue

reviews.headline: Didn't meet expectations
reviews.comments: I am a big Klair's girlie. I use the Vitamin E mask and Calendula cleanser but this oil was not what I expected. It became really hard to wash off and I ended up having to use literal hand soap to wash it off my hands altogether. Other oil cleansers will emulsify and melt off easily. I probably won't finish the bottle and will not order again.

reviews.headline: Good
reviews.comments: This is the first cleansing oil I tried (I'm a balm gal) and I really enjoyed it! There is little to no scent and it didn't leave my eyes blurry. It felt nice on the skin and washed off easily in my opinion. I would recommend this to a friend!

faceoff_positive.comments:
So far I've used the banila co cleansing balm and the Hanskin AHA cleansing oil. I fell in love with cleansing oils after how efficiently they removed all my makeup. 

This cleansing oil works just as well as the other two I've tried. It removes all my makeup with little effort, smells nice, and leaves my skin supple and soft. 

The only downside is that you HAVE to double cleanse (aka use a foaming cleanser after the oil cleanser) to remove it. The box for this product even recommends you combine it with their black sugar scrub before washing off. I didn't do that because I am not about to damage my skin with a sugar scrub. 

Overall it's really good, just takes an extra product to completely remove the leftover oil.
faceoff_positive.headline: Good cleansing oil, but a double cleanse is necessary

faceoff_negative.comments: I love Klairs, and I love cleansing oils and balms. I bought this when my other cleansing oil was about half finished so I didn't need it for months actually (why do I do this) and only just tried it yesterday. I knew from the very first use that I had messed up. This is a lesson to me not to buy new products unless I'm going to use them within the return period, or at least test them out. Rather than emulsifying and turning milky when I add water this almost gets thicker on my face and it takes a wash cloth and a double-cleanse to get it off. I try not to waste stuff but the idea of being stuck with this cleanser until it's finished is a little depressing. I might try to see if someone else wants it and just go back to my original oil cleanser. Hanskin oil cleanser never did me wrong like this, lol. I still love the Klairs supple toner to pieces, fragranced version even, but this one was a dud for me. I have to go wash my face in a bit and honestly, I think I'll use the ponds cold cream I have on hand and a cotton round to get my work makeup off, because that oil cleanser is such a pain. Definitely not for me.
faceoff_negative.headline: Wanted to love it, but it's kind of bad
